dialogues.text: Annie is at the piano, lost in a Beethoven concerto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie, it's one day.  One hour.  Maybe only 53 minutes.  Lucy needs you. (Annie keeps playing) You went to college.  You can give the right answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie plays even harder.  Frustrated, he POUNDS the piano

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't lose her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.  I'd make it worse for you.  I can't do it.  Don't you think I would if I could?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HEAR A VOICE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All rise for the Honorable Judge Phillip McNeily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam stands along with others in the courtroom.  The Judge enters and sits.  Everyone else sits now, too.  Except Sa Who continues to stand until Rita pulls him down.  Now we see: Ifty, Robert, Brad - and Brad's MOTHER, who sits several seats behind Brad knitting.  Robert holds up a handmade s from the back of the courtroom "Free Lucy Dawson".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turner, the prosecuting attorney, examines his first witn He's disheveled, but don't let the rumpled suit fool you. This man is razor-sharp.  The THERAPIST who evaluated Sam on the stand.  Sam anxiously rearranges all the pens on t desk he sits at with Rita.  Projected on a SCREEN is a SL of the drawing Lucy made in school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...there is an unhealthy reversal of roles here.  As you can see from her drawings, she has an exaggerated sense of responsibility.  Lucy feels she has to take care of her father.  Although at her birthday party her true feelings about her father were revealed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection.  "True feelings revealed"?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The state is paying Miss Geller for her opinions -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then every child who rages because they didn't get to stay up for that extra hour of TV -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection your honor -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam TUGS at Rita's sleeve.  She ignores it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...in fact any child who said they hated their parents because they didn't want to take a bath would be a prime candidate for Foster Care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think they want you to stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?!  Thank you, Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all appreciate your assistance Mr. Dawson - continue with your witness, Mr. Turner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Ms. Geller, I assume in your therapy session, Mr. Dawson extolled his parenting abilities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the contrary, Mr. Dawson admitted he felt profoundly inadequate - that he was terrified he'd made and would continue to make - and I quote: "Huge mistakes, huge mistakes, mistakes that are huge."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No further questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita starts to scribble notes furiously.  So does Sam.  Turner smugly sits down.  Rita confidently strides toward witness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a mother, aren't you Ms. Geller?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would it be fair to say that as a parent, you've felt confused from time to time, possibly overwhelmed on occasion, even though you're a wonderful mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection.  It's Mr. Dawson's parenting.  Not Ms. Geller's that's at question here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if Ms. Geller has never had a moment where she felt confused as a mother it would bias her opinion.  And it is her expert opinion we're all after, isn't it, Mr. Turner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Overruled.  I'll allow it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, your Honor.  Ms. Geller, I know there have been many moments as a parent where I've felt I've made huge mistakes - mistakes that are huge.  And I've had to admit them to myself.  My husband.  But most importantly, to my therapist.  Which is the guise Mr. Dawson thought he was seeing you under, isn't that right, Ms. Geller?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get to the point, Ms. Harrison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The point is you've never had those moments, have you Ms. Geller?  Moments that every parent I've ever spoken to has - moments when you've felt the task is so unbelievably challenging that you feel retarded, disabled in some way.  Moments when you feel everyone has the key but you.  But you've never had those moments, have you Ms. Geller?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes or no?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me rephrase the question.  When your son od'ed -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if Ms. Geller didn't feel she had made mistakes - mistakes that were huge it might bias her opinion toward Mr. Dawson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  So Ms. Geller - yes or no - when your son od'ed, did you feel you might have made mistakes, mistakes that were huge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tearfully) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Rita go down the cafeteria line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made her cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not nice.  Not very nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your secretary too.  Yellow and green in one bowl. (Sam stares at a bowl of Lima beans and corn) You separate the Lima beans from the corn please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAFETERIA WORKER stares at him.  Yeah.  Sure he will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, don't be impossible. (then to Worker) Can I have the spinach omelet - only egg whites no fat no oil no butter and extra mushrooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is anxiously separating his Lima beans and corn into separate piles.  They arrive at the cashier.  Rita pulls her billfold.  Sam reaches for his wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My treat.  My treat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be ridiculous.  I'll get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said it's my treat.  That means I'll get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, do you really want to get it or are you just trying to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trying to what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, trying to act like a -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a...a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A real man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're my lawyer and you think what they think.  I don't have a chance.  No chance at all.  Even with an expert witness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita looks at him.  He's right.  She chooses her words carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think...you deserve...a fair trial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answer the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay okay okay.  What was the question again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think what they think?  Sam can't order food.  Sam can't pay a check.  Sam can't take care of Lucy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter what I think - it matters that we win.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're my lawyer it matters what you think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, it doesn't matter to them what I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me.  It matters to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches for the receipt, and faces the CASHIER defiant

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fourteen thirty three.  That's 5 ones, 2 quarters and 16 cents less than twenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slowly counts his money, takes his tray and walks away Rita watches him, with a trace of remorse and a hint of admiration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. DONOVAN, an attractive soft-spoken woman is on the st Rita is working the room.  Sam, having a hard time concentrating, is following a crack up the wall and onto ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Donovan, the American Medical Journal named you one of the country's leading oncologists.  Isn't that correct?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kept you going the twelve years you were in medical school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caffeine.  Sugar.  And my mother's confidence in me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I had a mother like that.  She must have been smart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She had great instincts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any idea what her IQ was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the lower ranges.  About eighty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So your mother, this woman with the IQ of a nine-year old had the wisdom to recognize that you would be a great doctor.  I guess her disability didn't seem to hold you back in life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  My mother's condition taught me what they can't teach you; compassion and patience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Traits most doctors have in spades.  Thank you, no further questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam runs to hug Dr. Donovan, bumping into Rita who sits h down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you get through medical school?  Where'd you live?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We lived with my mother's parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Grandma and Grandpa.  Would it be fair to say your grandparents were of normal intelligence?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And didn't these people - your grandparents - with normal intelligence - have the real responsibilities?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relishing this) Objection!  I hear Mr. Turner's mother in-law lives with him!  She must help out.  Does that mean he doesn't have the real -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motion to strike that from the record.  Irrelevant, immaterial and immature -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irrelevant?!  Any parent has a right to a support system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not talking about the rights of the parent, I'm talking about the rights of a child. (the gavel bangs) I'm talking about entrusting an eight year old's welfare in the hands of someone whose records show he was diagnosed with infantile autism, mental retardation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection!  Motion to strike that from the record.  It's clear that one's intellectual capacity has no bearing on their ability to love.  You Honor, would you please instruct council to proceed with a modicum of sensitivity?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm sensitive.  I'm real sensitive when I see people like you -- (the gavel BANGS!) come here and try to give meaning to your life by screwing up somebody else's!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough.  Both lawyers approach the bench!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (both approach) And I suppose tearing apart a family is truly noble work, Mr. Turner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.  I fine you both for contempt.  Two-hundred fifty dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that to her?  She gets that for picking up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's what this is about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you what this is about.  See this is an award for you at some luncheon.  But I'm here everyday. (gavel POUNDS AGAIN) You win, you're out the door.  But guess who I see come back?  The kid.  Most of the time, in less than a year.  Only now it's too late.  So you're right.  I'm real sensitive.  You can't even touch that area.

dialogues.speaker: ON SAM
dialogues.text: Devastated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret Brown observes Sam and Lucy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how did he prove it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Columbus had to sail around the world to prove it was round.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so smart, Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam shoots a look at Margaret.  He hasn't heard anything about himself in so long.  Lucy looks into her father's e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we winning, Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam shoots ANOTHER look.  He doesn't want to lie.  Lucy catches the look between Sam and Margaret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, time's up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.  Just a little more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have another client at two-thirty.  You need to put your shoes on and get ready to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no!  There's a knot.  A really big knot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam attempts to undo it.  Lucy and he work very slowly, cherishing each moment together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She undoes it quickly.  Hands it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to go to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy's feet dangle from under the stall.  Margaret's stur shoes from under another.  Suddenly, Lucy's head pops out now she quietly wriggles out from under the stall, tip to across the room and out the door.  Locking it with a key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy runs up to her father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, she said we could go to the park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?  What made her change her mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I started crying in the bathroom.  She thought we needed more time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was so nice of her.  Very nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Lucy hold hands and look out the window.  Sam see Echo Park approaching and gets up.  Lucy pulls him back t the seat.  She looks Daddy in the eye and in a furtive whisper:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's not get off.  Let's keep going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Lucy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would be wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara's Mommy lost her case and Tamara hasn't seen her in six years.  She's had five different mommies and one of them hit her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't let that happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what her real mommy said.  And now they won't even let her talk to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam reels with confusion.  Lucy buries herself in his che

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, it's the only way to be together.  We'll start a new life, get new names.  We'll live in a new apartment.  They'll never find us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus has stopped.  Passengers for the park have exited Sam doesn't move.  As the BUSDRIVER closes the door and h on, he holds Lucy protectively to his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you Lucy.  I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name isn't Lucy anymore, it's Michelle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy sleeps cuddled close to Sam, who is wide awake, as h gazes out at the passing highway, far from home.  We hear song "Michelle". EXT. PARK - 4 A.M. Sam, totally disoriented, walks in circles around the pla tunnels and jungle gym.  A flashlight shines in Sam's fac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, buddy.  No loitering.  Move it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet not yet not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to get a black and white down here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves toward Sam.  SUDDENLY THE SPRINKLER SYSTEM goes The cop backs off, but Sam doesn't move, standing in the middle of the park and getting totally wet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet not yet not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shines the flashlight in Sam's face and we see INSIDE PLASTIC TUNNEL where LUCY SLEEPS PEACEFULLY on a bed of coats, holding a discarded stuffed animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hasn't been sleeping well.  She needs a good night's rest.  Let her sleep, let her sleep. (the cop moves toward Sam) NO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you, crazy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the cop sees is a lunatic walking in protective circl in the downpour of the sprinklers with a kid in a plastic tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police doors swing open as Rita, coat over pj's, a sleepy DANNY by her side, storm inside.  Lucy lies on a bench wi her head in Sam's lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you thinking what were you possibly thinking?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's ridiculous!  Danny stay with me - (he moves away) What could you possibly gain by kidnapping your kid in the middle of a custody hearing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna hear it!  Can you possibly explain this to me?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Lucy said -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's the parent here?  Who's the goddamned parent here?  Danny!  Stay in the hallway -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny turns the corner just as Margaret Brown rushes in.  Rita turns to her - her expression changes on a dime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Brown, I can imagine what you're thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I ask you what parent in their right mind seeing their child in pain --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have seen -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their yearning for contact - wouldn't take them in an attempt to comfort them?  Where the hell is Danny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes there is!  And if I were you I'd look at my conscience you do have one don't you long and hard before I tried to use this in court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a threat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  It's a plea.  Give'm a break.  Give'm one goddman break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret's cell phone RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!  No, Mrs. Sloan.  His temperature couldn't be 117, no not even 107.  Okay, okay, I'll come...Come on Lucy, I'll take you back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Danny.  We're going home.  Danny!?  Danny!?!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FIRE ALARM GOES OFF and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn it, Danny!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita avoids Margaret's look.  Margaret's cell phone goes again.  She doesn't answer.  Now Rita looks at Margaret, this time Margaret avoids looking at her.  Lucy runs to R and throws her arms around her waist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't fire us.  It was all my idea.  Please don't.  Please.  Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita is disarmed.  She's moved and not used to being move

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the whole truth, and nothing but the truth, so help you God?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy's in her best dress, being sworn in.  One hand in th air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So help me God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now CAMERA MOVES AROUND HER AND WE SEE THAT SHE'S HID HER OTHER HAND BEHIND HER BACK - FINGERS CROSSED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy is on the stand, Turner is cross-examining her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard you turned seven this year.  That's pretty exciting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody gets older.  It's not that big a deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you get for your birthday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't opened my presents yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?  That's odd.  Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy looks to her father and Rita.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I opened my presents.  I got the HELP album - limited edition.

dialogues.speaker: ON RITA AND SAM
dialogues.text: What is she doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm sorry.  I was confused.  I thought you didn't open your birthday presents because you ran away from your own party when your best friend told everyone that you were adopted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never said that; why would I say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would your friends say it if you hadn't said it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids lie all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next to her skirt, we see her fingers are crossed so hard they're practically turning purple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I remind you Lucy that you're under oath?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And do you know that means if you lie you could be in serious trouble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So now that you and I have agreed to tell the truth, where did you sleep last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita glares at Margaret.  Thanks a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my bed at the Foster home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Lucy.  If you're not going to tell the truth, I am.  Your dad kidnapped you last night and the police found you sleeping in a seedy park a hundred miles from here.  You're lying right now because you're afraid.  Afraid that everyone will see how scared and frustrated you really are.  You're afraid of hurting him, but now we need to tell the truth.  The truth is deep inside you know you're not getting what you need from your father.  Isn't that right, Lucy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LONG SILENCE.  She stares at Turner defiantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "All you need is love."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE HEAR THAT SONG as Sam and Rita walk out of the courtro Rita is breaking pieces off a candy bar she has stuffed i her purse.  They see Lucy running down the corridor towar Sam, Margaret Brown behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy!  I did great, didn't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Lucy, you lied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh!  Don't tell anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita watches Sam.  Moved by his concern as a parent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy, Mrs. Kerry's here to take you back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you'd be proud of me.  Jo Jo's mom told him to lie on the stand and say he never saw a needle in the house; and he did, and now they're back together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jo Jo isn't us.  The truth, the truth, when the judge hears the truth, he'll know, he'll know we should be together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bursting) Nobody's interested in the truth, Daddy.  Nobody cares!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They lead her down the hallway toward Mrs. Kerry - Sam's voice gets louder and louder - determined to make her hea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I CARE!  DO YOU HEAR ME?  THE TRUTH.  THE WHOLE TRUTH!  SO HELP ME GOD!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The darkness of Sam's apartment.  We see him on his knees Saying his prayers by his bedside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me, God.  Help me, God.  Help me, God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see ANNIE'S SILHOUETTE from the window of her apartmen it moves across the frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turner cross examines George, the manager of Starbucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam's my most reliable employee.  He's never missed a day of work in eight years.  Always warm, always friendly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admirable qualities for a single father.  Mr. Walker, in these eight years, have Mr. Dawson's responsibilities, which...let me see...would include bussing tables, replenishing Sweet 'n Lows, and sweeping up the place... increased?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Not really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And isn't that because he's mentally incapable of learning management skills or working the cash register or even making a cup of coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection.  Leading the witness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may answer the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George searches for a way to tell the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well as a matter of fact, Sam and I have been discussing a promotion that I was planning on putting into effect at the end of the week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam leaps to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh boy!  Thank you, George!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita pulls him down.  Turner seizes the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Thank you, George.  Now, after eight years, Sam can finally measure out a teaspoon of coffee and cup of water.  Now, he must certainly be able to help Lucy with her geometry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No further questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita prepares Ifty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and when I ask another question?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I answer in one sentence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Short and sweet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  One sentence.  Short and sweet.  My aunt was short and sweet.  But her cooking was too spicy she...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita's twitching foot knocks over her purse.  Out spill several Snickers Bars with the chocolate picked off them. Embarrassed, she kneels to pick them up when she and Sam something that stops them both, awestruck.  In the corner the corridor, huddled on a bench in dark sunglasses, sits ANNIE IN A PROFESSIONAL BUSINESS SUIT.  Sam runs to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie!  I can't believe it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (visibly trembling) Tell them to take me quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me one minute with the judge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie, wearing her dark glasses, is being questioned by R

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides being Lucy's godmother, aren't you also Lucy's piano teacher?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy's very lucky.  Didn't you graduate Magna Cum Laud from the Julliard School of Music?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Summa Cum Laud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (delighted) Excuse me.  Now Ms. Cassell, in all the time you've known them, have you ever questioned Sam's ability as a father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never.  Look at Lucy.  She's strong, she's able to display true empathy for people, all kinds of people.  I know you all think she's as bright as she is despite him.  But it's because of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turner stands where Rita did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can Sam add?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about multiplication?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's learning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what you're saying is that Sam can not even multiply two times two?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know about you, Mr. Turner, but my fondest memories of my parents have nothing to do with times tables or state capitals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet he's knocking on your door all the time with questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  All the time.  The last question was whether to use Biz or Clorox to get the grass stains out of Lucy's soccer uniform.

dialogues.speaker: ON RITA AND SAM
dialogues.text: This is too good to be true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So let's see..he doesn't know math...he can't even wash her clothes.  How about puberty?  I can only imagine how much insight he'll bring to approaching the sensitive issues of a young girl's development.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Turner, show me a father, any father, who knows how to do that and I'll give them the Parent of the Year award.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you've had plenty of opportunity to observe fathers, haven't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the fact that Ms. Cassell hasn't come out of her room in years might have some effect on her perception.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll allow it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had twenty eight years in the world to observe all kinds of fathers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about your father, Ms. Cassell?  Since you appear to be an expert on father-daughter relationships.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long pause.  Sam watches as Annie visibly tightens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Ms. Cassell, I didn't hear your response.  What about your father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie reaches for her water glass.  We see her hand SHAKE It knocks over the glass, shattering it on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection!  No further questions!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Mr. Dawson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said that's enough!  I will not allow it!  Overruled!  Overruled!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita doesn't stop him.  The Judge hesitates, incredulous, then pounds the gavel as the courtroom erupts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita sits in her Porsche with Annie and Sam.  Annie is cu into a tight ball in the passenger seat.  Sam is tucked i the shelf in the back.  His legs kick Rita in the face wi every gear shift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you again, Annie.  You were truly extraordinary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Extraordinary.  Truly extraordinary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay okay okay okay.  Well, Sam has his big day on the stand tomorrow and we need to work a little bit so that he's as effective as you were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Effective.  Very effective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a Porsche, the, uh, the door handle is a little hidden by that thingamajig, so if you're having a hard time finding it I'll just --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita reaches across to open Annie's door when she SCREAMS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noooooooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie's not quite ready to go outside yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, we'll just take our time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dark now.  Annie is still catatonic.  Rita's on the phone, the kind that voice activates and she's yelling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home!  Home!  HOME GODDAMNIT!  Juanita, help Danny with his English assignment.  Ayude Danny un story...story...STORIO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising from the dead) I'm ready now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently) Good, fine, Sam?  Annie's ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam's fallen asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita and Sam enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is awestruck at the magnificent home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay okay okay okay.  We'll work in the library.  It's down the hall and to the left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pass another room and see Danny zoned out in front o the wide-screen TV watching MUTANT NINJA TURTLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Danny.   (no answer) Where's your father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring at TV) Guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to guess.  Where is he? (Sam watches Rita) I told you I don't want to guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well where was he last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Working late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you guessed it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said he was working late?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what he said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well who did he say was taking care of you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You.  But you said you were working late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am working late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then go work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was your day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to work.  Go work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  How was your -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her CELL PHONE goes off.  Rita moves into the hallway to answer her phone.  Sam moves into the den, sits on the co the sound of Rita arguing with her husband drifts into th room.  Sam looks sideways at Danny who remains stonefaced

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my favorite part.  Hey Dommy, this one looks like he's suffering from shell shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy I guess we can shell it out... It was a shell of a good hit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita stands in the doorway watching Sam have a longer conversation with her son than she's had in months.  She retreats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny and Sam eat popcorn watching the movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bellowing) "Turtles in the half-shell, turtle power!"  Rita!  Come this is the best part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads towards Rita.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the half-light Sam catches a glimpse of Rita standing the pantry unconsciously stuffing marshmallows into her mouth.  Their eyes lock for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You eat too fast.  Come watch the movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's getting late.  We have to get to work. (handing him a suit) This is my husband's.  He won't notice.  He's got ten more just like it.  Try it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam comes out of the bathroom in the new suit.  Rita star at him astonished.  He looks incredibly handsome.  Rita, attempting to stifle her reaction, turns away from Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Very, very good.  But your tie's crooked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita stands behind Sam with her around him showing him ho do his tie properly.  Their images are reflected in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cross over once.  Loop it around on the inside of your neck. (her hand grazes his neck) Slide the other side through the loop, then tighten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita comes around to the front and straightens and tighte the tie.  They are both nervous.  The room is charged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay okay okay okay.  Our strategy is that we're aggressively pursuing a support system.  I'm going to ask you h ow are you prepared to help Lucy in school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see let me see let me see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam!  I told you you have to stop that!  It makes you look stupid!  Okay okay okay.  Try again. (endless pause) You say you will find her a tutor.  Then I say, "How will you pay for it?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you slow down?  Why do you eat so fast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring him) We've gone over this a million times.  You've found a free tutoring service for her at the YMCA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I didn't.  You did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you grasp the concept of manipulating the truth?  Not lying.  Just a little tweak here and there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...You're so lucky.  You get to play with Danny all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't want to play with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes he does.  He does he does.  He thinks you don't want to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh that's ridiculous of course I want to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tweak, tweak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exploding) I drove around after work yesterday 'til 9:30 looking for a goddman razor scooter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in his own world) Tweak, squeak, peek peek...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita shifts uneasily, embarrassed by her overreaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, why did you harass that young boy at your home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I didn't harass him, Rita.  You know that, you know that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, I'm pretending to be Mr. Turner, remember?  Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah yeah yeah yeah.  I didn't harass him, Mr. Turner.  Mr. Turner - (Sam can't keep a straight face) You don't look like him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a blessing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so much prettier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly shy) Thank you.  Now.  What makes you think you can take care of a woman - I mean a young child - when you have a hard time taking care of yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita is relentless.  Sam is exhausted but determined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But who are you kidding?  Isn't Lucy already smarter than you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In some ways.  But in other ways, she's not, I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam.  You've got to be firm on this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think in other ways I'm smarter than her.  Smarter than you are, Mr. Turner.  In fact, in some ways I'm smarter than you, Judge McNeilly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa!  Bring it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What parent doesn't want more for their child?  To be more than the sum of the parts of the whole of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah yeah yeah, but it's one thing for a little girl to love her daddy when she's a baby, but once she loses respect for you, what will you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fierce) I won't let that happen.  I won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Respect is not just about how smart someone is.  Smart is not just about how smart someone is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what about Lucy?  Aren't you being selfish?  Doesn't she deserve a better life?  Don't you think she's just pretending she's happy to not hurt your feelings?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam jumps up from the table, trembling with anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy is happy!  We have fun!  We go to Denny's, we go to video night.  I know how to love her.  I know I'm not going to able to go to law school and learn how to be a mean person, but I know how to love.  I know how to be her father, Mr. Turner!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By this time he is face to face with Rita, breathing hard overcome with emotion.  Rita is unexpectedly near tears.  Suddenly before she knows it, she is HOLDING SAM.  The ro charged.  She speaks tenderly, moved by this awkward boy/

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you do, Sam.  I know you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam rushes into the coffee shop in his new suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look great, Sam.  What time do you have to be in court?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half day, half day.  I take the stand at two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George leads him behind the counter.  THE STAFF BEAMS.  Euphorically, Sam approaches the huge espresso machines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, we need two grande cappucinos, non fat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sprinkles or Cinnamon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is doing great.  He's humming as he prepares a triple latte with the precision of a Swiss watchmaker. INT. STARBUCKS - 12:00 P.M. The place is packed, including a GROUP OF JAPANESE TOURIS Sam zips around, trying to juggle between the blender, th espresso machine, steamed milk, icemaker, all the while glancing up at the clock.  Sam hands three cups to custom the foam overflowing, coffee spilling out. A CUSTOMER takes a sip and SPITS IT OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this?  I ordered an Americano, not a latte.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Americano, Americano, not a latte.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Working as fast as he can but still NOT FAST ENOUGH, Sam unconsciously drinks the latte. INT. STARBUCKS - 12:45 P.M. Hyped on coffee, Sam is zooming around and he's a mess.  Shirt hangs out, coffee stains on it, his hair wild.  Frazzled, he forgets to put the lid on the blender and tu it ON.  A mint mocha frappuccino SPLATTERS HIM in the fac At that moment, George comes out of his office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to be late!  I'm going to be late!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call a taxi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, I can't wait.  I can't wait.  I've got to go right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam heads out, the coffee drink still dripping from his f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walking a hundred miles an hour, Sam barrels down the str out of his mind.  Cars are jammed up.  He walks over them man possessed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is in their places, waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Honor, if the defendant doesn't have enough interest in his daughter to even show up -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Honor, I'm sure he'll be here any moment.  This is an extremely important day to Mr. Dawson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At THAT MOMENT, Sam bursts through the doors.  Suit stain hair sticky with frappuccino.  Rita's jaw drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Honor, may I have a moment with my client?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make it brief, Ms. Harrison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita heads towards Sam.  Up close, he looks even worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell happened? (sniffing the air) What is that smell?  Mint?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, determined, heads for the stand.  Rita grabs Sam's shoulders and tries to focus him.  Looks deep into his ey

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, look at me.  Look at me!  (he does) I will guide you like last night. (Sam hugs her) Not that part of last night, the other part.  Now you can do it.  I know you can.  Lucy needs you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a mile a minute) Lucy needs me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, slow down because Lucy needs you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy needs you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Harrison.  We need you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, on the stand, talks a mile a minute from the coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How will you be able to pay for private tutoring?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a free program at the YMCA.  Lucy can go there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But don't you ever think it would be better for Lucy if she lived with a permanent foster family and you could visit whenever you wanted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Fosters don't know her.  Why can't she live with me and they can come visit if they want to.  I'm firm on this.  And I'm getting firmer.  Lucy belongs with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam puts his finger to his chin and starts his "Let me see..." Rita gives him a look; he lowers his finger and starts talking very fast from the coffee.  The STENOGRAPH desperately tries to keep pace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul wrote the first part of the song "Michelle".  He said to John, "Where do I go from here?"  John had been listening to Nina Simone.  There was a line in it that went something like, "I love you, I love you, I love you..." They put that into the song.  It wouldn't be the same song without that.  It made the song complete.  That's why the whole world cried when they broke up on April 10, 1970.

dialogues.speaker: ON RITA
dialogues.text: Well, he has some kind of point.  MARY, the Stenographer, is still typing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get that, Mary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turner fires questions at Sam - a mile a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you were Lucy's age, were you living at home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you living with your mother and father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then where were you living?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very quietly) In an institution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So your parents put you in an institution?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only after my mom got sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about your father?  Where was he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gone with the wind when Sam was born.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you weren't raised by your mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw her I saw her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christmas, Easter and my birthday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, once a year on your birthday.  So in a way, the people at the institution were your parents.  Were they nice to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some yes.  Some on.  Some yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did they hit you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes.  Sometimes they did sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like when you hit Lucy's friend at her birthday party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection!  Nobody hit anybody!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me rephrase that, strong-armed.  So what role model do you call upon as a father when you're parenting Lucy?  The head of the institution?  The Principal  the warden?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Not Mr. Whitehead.  Not him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: you have the mental capacity of a seven year old.  So you ask yourself, a seven year old -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not a seven-year old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How to parent a fellow seven-year old?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  No.  What was the question?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The question is: what makes you think you can be a parent?  Your background?  Your IQ?  Your friends who can't even testify for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My friends -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My friends love Lucy even if Rita thought they weren't smart enough to testify.  Even if she said you'd wipe the floor with them.

dialogues.speaker: ON RITA
dialogues.text: Trying to telepathically reach Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Mr. Dawson, your lawyer just objected; that means you didn't have to answer the question.  You can't even follow the simple rules you've watched here day after day.  You really think you can raise a seven-year old?  A ten year old?  A thirteen-year old? (in his face) That means she'll be six years more advanced than you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweat pours down Sam's coffee stained collar.  He searche for words.  Then from the clearest place inside himself:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had a lot of time to think about whatever it is that makes somebody a good parent.  It has to do with constancy.  It has to do with patience.  It has to do with listening.  To pretending to listen when you can't even listen anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The court is riveted by Sam's eloquence.  Rita's amazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has to do with love, like she says...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita's antenna goes up: who's "she?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I don't know where it's written that a woman has a corner on that market, that a man has any less of those emotions than a woman.  Billy has a home with me!  It's not perfect!  I'm not a perfect parent!  Sometimes I forget he's just a little kid... (whispers from the courtroom) We built a life together and we love each other and if you destroy that, it may be irrep, irrep, irrep...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irreparable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes TURN to the back of the room.  Ifty is there try with all his might to help his friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joanne, don't do that, please.  Don't do it twice, not to him.  Then Meryl Streep can't even look at Dustin Hoffman after that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, "Kramer vs. Kramer."  Thank you for the commentary, Mr. Bhutto.  It's hard to find words isn't it, Mr. Dawson.  It's confusing.  It's confusing to know what to say to Lucy half the time, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mortified, so uncomfortable in this strange world, so at loss how to swim through it, beginning to believe everyth Turner's saying, Sam looks out at the faces in the courtr Rita, stunned and incredulous; Turner and his associate smirking at him; Ifty, shaking his head; Robert, his face his hands; Miss Wright, Margaret Brown, the State's Exper almost willing him to fail.  Are they right?  Are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, yes, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see let me see let me see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  You're right, you don't know.  You don't know enough to really raise your daughter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection.  These aren't questions, these are attacks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frantic) I am Lucy's father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you?  Are you really?  I'm not talking about the fact that you got some homeless woman pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection your Honor.  I motion a recess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denied.  Get to the question, Mr. Turner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The question is if you love your daughter as much as they say you do don't you think she deserves more?!  Don't you?  In your heart of hearts, secretly question yourself every day?  Don't you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was that a "yes?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  She does.  She deserves everything.  In my heart of hearts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes she does.  And you agree with everyone, you can't give her that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in unbearable pain) Maybe.  Maybe everybody's right.

dialogues.speaker: ON TURNER
dialogues.text: There.  He got it.

dialogues.speaker: ON RITA
dialogues.text: Anguished.  Watching Sam unravel as he stands up and star walking around in a circle in the witness box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more no more!  Let it stop!  No more!  No more!  No more!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Judge watches Sam, sad and stunned.  The verdict is obvious.  Sam has passed judgement on himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, broken, walks down the long hallway with Rita toward Margaret Brown's office.  Suddenly, Rita stops as she and both see -

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Sitting, hopeful on the bench.  She searches Sam's face f the verdict.  The minute she sees sorrow in his eyes, she knows.  She runs to him, gluing herself to his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Daddy!  No Daddy!  No Daddy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a SERIES OF WORDLESS DISSOLVES, they hold each other i the hallway through the entire forty five minute visit. only thing moving is the hands of a large wall clock in t background.  Pained, Margaret reaches for Lucy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Lucy.  It's time to say goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOOOO!  Don't let go don't let go don't let go -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam's tears mix with Lucy's as they sob, clinging to each other.  With such fierce love; a parent and a child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let them Daddy don't let them!  Don't ever let me go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't let her go.  That he can't do.  Margaret, steel herself, turns to Rita, no matter how many times she's do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita, aching from a place she thought she buried long ago shakes her head, NO.  Now, Margaret literally has to wren Lucy away from her father's arms.  Lucy bellowing as she pulls her down the hallway.  Sam is frozen in incalculabl pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear "Fool on the Hill".  We follow a trail of PINK LI melting down the hall and come to Annie's door where a pi of grocery bags and newspapers sit in a PUDDLE OF STRAWBE ICE CREAM.  Suddenly, the needle SCRAPES LOUDLY across th record, followed by a mysterious POUNDING against the wal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA MOVES to the WINDOW.  Inside, the lights are d Lucy's HAMMOCK SWINGS EMPTY, ghostlike.  Sam, curled into ball in Lucy's bare corner, bangs his head over and over again against the wall, overcome with grief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The POUNDING CONTINUES as we see Rita standing in the doorway, watching her sleeping child.  This stranger that she's raised.  She moves to cover him, this tough little when she sees POOH BEAR tucked under his arm.  She tucks both in, tenderly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saturday in idyllic suburbia.  Sam, directions and a map his hands, tentatively rounds the corner.  A small bouque flowers in his hands when he stops - STARING AHEAD AT --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy looking absolutely radiant in a new spring dress.  S stands on the front porch with RANDY, who wears a red smo and is setting up TWO EASELS AND PAINTS.  There's a tiny chair for Lucy and a tiny chair for her.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY AND RANDY
dialogues.text: The tension in Lucy's face, Randy straining to connect wi her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your teacher told me you were an artist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wear too much perfume.  You're trying too hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am, aren't I.  Maybe you could teach me how to paint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My daddy's coming today.  We're going to open my birthday presents.  Why don't you just go do something.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SAM
dialogues.text: From where he stands, all he sees is Lucy getting everyth she deserves.  He looks down at the tiny bouquet in his h feeling profoundly inadequate, he reaches for some flower from a garden he's passing.  Puts them in his bouquet.  T stops.  Feels guilty.  Tries to put the flowers BACK.  He stares up at Lucy on the porch a few houses away. Lucy sits on the steps.  Randy sits right next to her.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON SAM
dialogues.text: Where he WAS standing, but is now GONE.  The flowers lay the dirt.  From the porch, Lucy looks out and waits.  And waits.  And waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Saturday.  The place is buzzing.  Sam listlessly cle the tables, without the usual energy and verve.  A TODDLE marches around a table, playing under the adoring gaze of parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, my kid knocked over a coffee, could you clean this up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam sees a FAMILY at a table covered with spilled coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I need a refill and a towel over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snapping) You need a towel?  A refill?  A glass of water?  You need more than you already have?  You have everything - (all his fury and frustration) Everything.  But it's not enough.  Take my daughter, too!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam's out of control, the whole shop stares at him as he backs into a shelf of MUGS he so carefully arranged.  The CRASH onto the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paints and brushes go FLYING across the porch as Lucy KNO THEM OVER.  Totally out of control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gave him the wrong address!  You're hiding me from him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Randy reaches for her, Lucy pours black paint on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy sits in a ball on the corner of the porch.  Her eyes swollen from crying.  Finally, she gets up and moves to t tiny chair that Randy put out for her.  Straightens the e and begins to paint. The front door opens and Randy comes out having washed he face and hair.  Without speaking, Randy straightens her e and sits down next to Lucy and begins to paint.  Randy an Lucy paint in silence for a long time.  Then -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to send me away now, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tenderly) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear what sounds like a child's hand playing the song "Here, There and Everywhere..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see SAM sitting at Lucy's miniature toy piano as he pl with one finger.  IN A SERIES OF DISSOLVES, as DAYS and W PASS, we see SAM'S HANDS at the PIANO -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Lucy and Randy's hands as they PAINT side by side to Sam's sad melody.  Lucy's pictures start ANGRY, angular w blacks and blues, then GRADUALLY soften and the dark figu recede.  By the END, there is a BRUSHSTROKE of the red of Randy's smock peeking into the corner of Lucy's picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We come back to Sam, having withdrawn completely into him serenading no one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Lucy and Randy sitting on her bed unwrapping the birthday presents.  TIME HAS PASSED.  They look close, al like a mother and daughter.  Lucy finishes unwrapping Sam present and we see a stack of ONE HUNDRED DENNY'S NAPKINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, he must've forgotten to put the gift in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy picks up one of Lucy's pictures and moves to the wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, this wall really needs something special on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy half-smiles and unconsciously begins to fold one of Denny's napkins into an origami bird.  Then crushes it. cautiously:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the longest any one of those kids stayed with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan stayed a little over a year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (averting her eyes) Did you ever want any of them to stay longer?

dialogues.speaker: ON RANDY
dialogues.text: Moved herself.  Understanding how huge a question this is coming from this bruised little heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam sits in a dark corner; maniacally folding newspaper i an odd origami pattern.  There's a knock at the door - Sa doesn't move, he just continues folding his paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam it's me!  Open up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't answer it, just methodically folds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita stands there impatiently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have time for this!  You were supposed to show up for your first evaluation.  And I leave work early to get there and where the hell are you?!  Open the door!  Sam!  Open the goddamn door! (nothing) Alright.  If you don't care enough to open the goddamn door I'm outta here!  I've ruined my practice, I've alienated my colleagues - I sent my kid off on a fishing trip with his father so I could work with you and you won't open your goddman door for me?!  Fine!  THAT'S IT!  I've had enough!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts down the hall when suddenly she turns and - wi the mastery of a karate black belt - RUNS AND KICKS the d down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita bursts through the door and then stops.  Sam has cre an origami wall of newspapers, intricately woven together A fortress against the world.  He keeps folding - doesn't even look at Rita.  He's more far gone than she could imagine, she walks gingerly to the wall and knocks gently it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, it's Rita.  Can I come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No room.  No room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.  I lived in the East Village.  I don't need a lot of room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam makes life too hard.  Sam makes life too hard on everyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, I can go at least nine more rounds.  But you gotta let me in.  Please Sam.  Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls out one small brick of origami, opening a window

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  Now I can see your kind eyes...George told me you needed a break from work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to work there anymore.  Too many people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we could find you a quieter job.  Because remember one of the judges conditions is you have to earn more money; you've got to keep earning more money for when we get you Lucy back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy doesn't need me anymore.  She has a new family.  She doesn't need me anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what she said?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't have to say it.  I may be stupid, but I know.  I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that's the first stupid thing I've ever heard you say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam looks at her through the window.  A CHINK in the wall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, Sam you can get her back.  The court favors reunification.  The only thing that can block you is if the foster family petitions to adopt.  And from what I've heard, Lucy's making their life miserable - that's our girl.  Sam, fight for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried.  I tried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know.  You don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know what it is to try and try and never get there.  You were born perfect, perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that right?  Everyone else is perfect but only Sam feels loss and pain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.  People like you don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People like me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People like you don't know, don't know what hurt feels like, people like you don't feel, don't feel anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slaps him.  STUNNED, he slaps her back.  STUNNED, she slaps him again.  HE SLAPS HER.  She rips the newspaper w down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you got the market cornered on human suffering?  Well let me tell you something about "People like me."  People like me feel little and lost and ugly and dispensable.  People like me have perfect husbands screwing someone far more perfect than me and my son, my son hates me, I try too hard and I push and he knows it and I talk in that voice, that voice I promised I'd never use, and I've screamed, I've screamed horrible things to him, a five year-old because he doesn't want to get in the car at the end of a day and he stares at me with such anger and I hate him then.  I know I'm failing you, I know I'm disappointing you, I know you deserve better but get in the fucking car!  It's like every morning I wake up and fail, and I look around and anybody, anybody can pull it off, but somehow I can't.  And I know, I know I have everything, and I'm still miserable and it's pathetic.  I know it's pathetic.  No matter how hard I try, something about me will never be enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's crying too hard to continue.  He pulls her to him.  Before she realizes what's happening, she's holding him tightly.  He whispers in her ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're enough.  You're so much more than enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks her straight in the eye - she's undone by the intimacy of the moment, by the strength of his purity.  A staring into his eyes, she begins to sob, walls crumbling He kisses her elbow, her shoulder, her forehead, her eyes her tears.  And something ignites between them - somethin confused and scary and deep and filled with a passionate ache.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lovely Rita...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a bed of newspaper that was once a wall they come together, whole again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam rounds the corner walking - or rather being walked by DOGS, all shapes, all sizes.  He heads up the walkway to Randy's house.  She comes out of the house and shuts the behind her, stopping him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the lights were green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a reason for the court schedule.  You stopped showing up.  Lucy has had to rebuild her life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want her back.  I can do it.  I know I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not up to me, but I'm telling you, I will do everything in my power to prevent Lucy from getting hurt again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam hangs his head.  A dog barks at Randy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose dogs are these?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Supplemental income supplemental income - bathe, walk and feed.  Sam Dawson meets your canine needs. (to dogs) Sit! Sit! Sit! Sit! Sit! Sit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the dogs sit but a BIG BLACK LAB.  Randy heads into t house.  The front door opens and Lucy comes out.  She run down the stares to Sam.  Thrilled, Sam opens his arms to She leaps into them and begins slugging his chest with pe up fury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never came!  You never even called!  You forgot about me!  How could you forget me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never forgot you.  I forgot me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate you I hate you I hate you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy pulls away.  A long charged silence.  Lucy refusing even look at her father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy, I tried to write you a letter last night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gesundheit, Buster.  Buster has a cold.  But the letter had too many big words.  Pokey, sit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The black lab has begun eating Randy's flowers.  Lucy sta forward.  Sam speaks tentatively, carefully:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear Lucy.  Pokey sit.  Dear Lucy, I'm sorry that I hurt you.  Every moment of the day I thought about you.  Lucy in the hammock, Lucy at school.  Lucy in the sky...XXOO.  Daddy.  P.S. I love you, recorded September 11th, the day you took your first step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy raises her head and looks at Sam for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: ON SALAD BAR
dialogues.text: Rows of carrots, tomatoes, cucumbers and - uh-oh, a tomat in the peas.  A hand comes into frame and carefully place the tomato just so, in the tomato bin.  Now it moves to t olives.  Shouldn't all the pimentos be facing up?

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK
dialogues.text: To reveal Sam, in white apron and hat, deftly filling the containers of the elaborate salad bar as people fill thei plates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Napa cabbage, excellent choice.  Purple and green, purple and green.  Very rich in Vitamin C.  Good choice. Very good choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam walks toward the courtroom when we see Rita approachi from the other end of the hall.  They both slow down when they see each other.  Rita unconsciously fixes her hair. adjusts his tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Sam.  Mr. Dawson.  Sam.  Dawson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They almost shake hands - realize that means touching eac other and don't.  Rita motions toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  We already did.  Don't tell anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They nervously walk through the door, bumping into each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's very aware of Sam.  He looks away, over compensatin obviously.  Throughout the scene, Rita's hair falls in he eyes.  She attempts to put it in place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Furthermore, my client has found a new job, and is making every effort to find a bigger apartment so that -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita's hair falls in her eyes again.  Sam stands up, pull HER BARRETTE from his pocket, the one she left at his hou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita stares at the barrette as if it were the murder weap

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, thank you.  What a...a lovely barrette, Mr. Dawson.  It will look great on Lucy.  Who I'm sure you bought it for.  Furthermore, so that...there will be more room for Lucy as she grows up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of that is well and good but the fact that Mr. Dawson quite his job, missed his hearing, and did not even show up for his visits with his daughter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fact that my client went through profound depression is the most natural reaction any parent could have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But once again he had no idea how his behavior during that depression impacted on his daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In these next months, Mr. Dawson will be expanding his support system to include Social Service programs, tutors --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too late!  The foster family is petitioning the court for sole custody of Lucy and I fully support their request.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam turns to Rita.  This can't be happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, Rita, Ifty, Robert and Brad sit in a booth.  With on extra person, it's a little tight.  Rita picks at her Salisbury Steak special, trying to deal with the business hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it illegal?  It's illegal to go through stop signs.  It's illegal to cross on the red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not illegal.  It's very complicated.  When a strong foster parent lobbies for a child it changes the equation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're reaching right through Sam as if he doesn't exist.  As if he's a ghost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's one option we've never talked about, Sam.  (very carefully) I know what you went through the last time you took the stand.  We could settle out of court, ask for the most incredible visitation rights - it would almost seem like joint custody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're saying I don't have a chance.  That's what you're saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not saying you don't have a chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you said last time and look where he is now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop.  Rita's not saying I don't have a chance.  Are you?  Tell me I have a chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too long a pause.  Ifty looks at the clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God!  6:35 is Video Night at my house and I'm not even there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we get there before you do we'll wait for you - check!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam get your dessert to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is very hard to say.  I'm having my dessert here.  With Rita.  I'm not coming to video night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Devastated, Ifty, Robert and Brad solemnly gather their things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam - if you want to go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said no, Rita.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but if you -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  Do you want me to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say that.  But do you want to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nevermind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. IFTY, ROBERT & BRAD Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They leave in a huff.  The WAITRESS delivers the check wi dessert and coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long pause.  Rita slowly eats her pie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good to chew.  You're eating more slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita laughs and nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coconut Rhubarb.  Sidebar, we need to talk.  Sidebar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (carefully) Yes we do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to get Lucy back.  We need, we need - to be professional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know what that means?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When dealing with Starbucks' customers, be friendly but not familiar.  I can be your friend.
