dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (oddly touched) Thank you, Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to leave your husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (her armor up again) Oh, my marriage isn't so bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Life is very short and there's no time for fussing and fighting, my friend.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (undone) It's just...it's just that...I've never lost anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy kisses Lucy goodbye as she heads toward school.  We follow Lucy - suddenly a BIRD SAILS THROUGH THE SKY and L IN FRONT OF LUCY.  It's an ORIGAMI BIRD.  She looks aroun but doesn't see Sam anywhere.  But she feels him.  She wa toward school, clutching the bird, past a tree and we mov that tree and see Sam nestled in the branches.  There.  T made contact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's later that week.  Lucy walks proudly down the street a GIRL SCOUT UNIFORM, selling cookies.  Randy is by her s beaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've made $22.36.  That's seven dollars, 64 cents less than thirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that's one way of looking at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DISSOLVE as they move through the neighborhood.  Finally see her bound up the steps to an apartment building.  She knocks on the door.  It opens - and Lucy and Randy's JAW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam stands there.  Holding three kittens.  WE see various dogs in arm chairs, the couch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I live here.  This is where I live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where you live?  So close to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to be close to you.  I wanted to be closer.  Look at my apartment number. (it's number 9) John was born on October 9th.  His son was born on October 9th.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John met Yoko on November 9th.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His mother lived at 9 Newcastle, Liverpool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newcastle.  9 letters.  Liverpool - 9 letters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy, give me one minute with your father.  Sam, I consider myself an understanding person but I don't understand this.  You can't close the distance between you and Lucy with a new address.  We go to court in a week -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to spend half my visit with Lucy on the bus getting to Lucy.  I don't want to waste one more minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buster sneezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the doorway) Does Buster still have his cold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's better, much better.  Now I'll have one box of mint chocolate cookies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll be three-eighty six. LUCY & SAM (in unison) Let me see let me see let me see... That's one dollar and 14 cents less than five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy watches with a mixture of jealousy and fear as Lucy effortlessly enters her and Sam's universe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the window, Randy watches as Sam hands Lucy four lea and the two of them get pulled down the street by the dog INT. LUCY'S BEDROOM - 2 A.M. Lucy lies in her hammock, unable to sleep.  Staring at th little origami bird on her window sill.  She moves it, op the window wide, quickly takes Mr. Jeeters - and within a moment she's out the window and onto the limb of the tree

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The night grows teeth..." stray dogs fight over garbage wino talks to himself and in the midst of it all walks Lu in her pj's.  Mr. Jeeters tucked under her arm.  Lucy cro the street.  HONK!  the screeching of tires...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're looking at an old fashioned fire escape when sudden we make out a figure climbing higher and higher.  It's Lu We catch glimpses of her and then lose her as the neon si across the street blinks on and off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam's asleep.  Suddenly his eyes open wide.  And like an animal sensing danger, he gets up.  We HEAR THE SOUND of something THUMPING AGAINST RUNG AFTER RUNG OF THE FIRE ESCAPE.  He rushes to his window and looks to see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy climbing the fire escape!  Sam opens the window and reaches for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy Lucy.  What are you doing?!  You could have really hurt yourself.  What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't sleep.  Daddy, did you know that Warren G. Harding was the twenty ninth President of the United States?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember - the twenty-ninth President.  In case the Judge asks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, in his pajamas, holds a sleeping Lucy in his arms. turns a corner and heads up the walkway to Randy's house. knocks on the door.  Finally the door opens and we see Ra and Bill in their pajamas SHOCKED at seeing Sam and Lucy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She couldn't sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me my daugh - (she stops herself) Give me - I'll take Lucy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe if you rub her tummy twenty-three times, tell her two stories and give her half a Denny's blueberry muffin and a third of a glass of milk she'll sleep.  Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy and BILL, her husband, watch as Sam turns and walks purposely down the walkway - his houseslippers scuffling the quiet street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy in her pj's walks down the middle of the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy knocks on Sam's window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy and Sam walk back down the street to Randy's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy lugs encyclopedias to Sam's windowsill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy in a blanket being carried by Sam toward Randy's hou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until FINALLY, we see Lucy in her hammock at Randy's hous looking out the windows, which have now been completely covered with BARS.  Her room is filled with origami birds from the 100 Denny's napkins, her birthday gift.  Lucy ge out of her hammock and tiptoes across her room - quietly opening the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow her through the dark house as she creeps down t stairs.  She gets to the front door.  It's been DEAD BOLT where she cannot reach it.  From the darkness we hear --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tenderly) Lucy.  Come here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy sits in the darkness, next to a THIRD OF A GLASS OF MILK and a HALF A DENNY'S BLUEBERRY MUFFIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made us a midnight snack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy stares at the muffin and milk.  Torn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand that you want to see your daddy.  And I don't want to keep you from him.  I honestly don't.  So you tell me when you want to see him.  You can see him anytime you want.  But we have to arrange it first.  Do you understand? (Lucy nods) Now would you like a snack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy nods.  Elated, Randy makes room for her on the couch But Lucy just reaches for the milk and muffin and heads u the stairs then turns back and speaks gently to Randy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  Goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (words caught in her throat) Goodnight, Lucy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PAN ACROSS THE ROOM and see Sam's shoes, his tie, and

dialogues.speaker: YELLOW PAD WITH ALL THE PRESIDENTS LISTED IN ORDER. A KN
dialogues.text: at the door - Sam opens it to see Rita standing there, looking intensely vulnerable, holding her husband's suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My husband left this when he moved out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, lovely Rita, meter maid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (entering) Nice place.  I worry.  I worry sometimes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You worry you did the wrong thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I worry that I've gotten more out of this relationship than you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No no no.  I'm the lucky one.  I have the lawyer that never loses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (covering) That's me...okay, let me see, let me see, let me see. (pulls out notes) They're going to put Bill and Randy on the stand first and then you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Them first, then me.  They're a nice couple.  They have a nice house.  She's pretty.  She's smart, too.  I can tell.  The manager of the salad bar is gonna testify, isn't he?  That will help us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a moment, Rita's mask drops and her fear for Sam overwhelms her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody believed that George Harrison could really be a song writer.  But he wrote "Here Comes the Sun".  John and Paul said it was one of the best songs on ABBEY ROAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tenderly) George was always my favorite Beatle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy's was Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy and Bill are asleep when Randy senses something.  S opens her eyes and sees Lucy staring at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now.  I want to see him now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Sam sleeping in bed.  There's a KNOCK at the door. Sam wakes with a start, throws down the covers.  We see that he's wearing the Armani suit.  Sam opens the to see Randy standing there, holding a sleeping Lucy in h arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She fell asleep on the car ride over.  I was gonna turn back and tuck her in to her bed...with the pink canopy...and the quilt I made...But I was afraid she'd wake up at our house... (fighting the ache in her soul) ...and want to come home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam looks at Randy with profound compassion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was gonna tell the judge that I could give Lucy the kind of love she never had.  But I would be lying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope I hope I hope that you're saying what I think you're saying even though you're not saying it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy nods and hands the sleeping Lucy into Sam's strong arms.  For a moment they BOTH HOLD LUCY between them in t most unique embrace.  Randy finally lets go and struggles say goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight.  I'll see you in court.  Save me a seat...on your side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy walks away.  Stunned, Sam watches her, holding Lucy his arms.  Then, from a very brave place:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy!  If I tell you I can't do it alone, will you tell the judge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns gently) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've looked and looked for a mother for Lucy.  Help, I need someone, help, not just anyone.  You're the red in Lucy's painting.

dialogues.speaker: ON RANDY
dialogues.text: So unexpectedly bonded to them both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A glorious sunny day.  Lucy and her team are in the middl a fierce game.  A foul is called when we hear -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Penalty!  Rules broken.  Penalty, please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, wearing a UNIFORM and whistle around his neck, walki his inimitable walk, races up the field, COACHING THE TEA Ifty, Robert and Brad sit in the bleachers.  Robert, in sunglasses, paranoid, looking behind him.  Brad follows around an attractive YOUNG WOMAN as close as he can get t her.  Sam runs by the water stand, manned by Randy and Bi They share a look - a moment of intense parental pride. and a kid named PHILLIP go after the ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get her!  Phillip, you get her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw that!  You gave him a secret signal!  Didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep both eyes on the ball, Lucy - balls are round - on sale at Kmart.  The earth is a ball, too...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip steps in front of Lucy and shoves her as hard as can.  Sam blows his whistle repeatedly and races over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Penalty!  Repeat!  Rules broken!  Penalty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Penalty?!  Sue him!  Kick his ass outta the game!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's RITA!  With Danny - hollering from the stands.

dialogues.speaker: ON LUCY
dialogues.text: Looks over at her father.  Sam does every coaching gestur and referee hand signal from every sport known to man.  I looks like a bizarre TWYLA THARP DANCE.

dialogues.speaker: ON LUCY
dialogues.text: She does it right back at him.  Their secret code.  The c that will bind them for the rest of their lives.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE CROWD AND PLAYERS
dialogues.text: All watching.  What the hell was that?  Sam blows his whistle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Play ball!  Play ball!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The game heats up.  Lucy's team gets the ball and is head toward the goal.  Sam is running right alongside them, so excited, until he can't hold himself back anymore and intercepts the ball!  Sam runs valiantly down the field w it!  We hear "Here Comes the Sun"... Little darlin', it's been a long, cold lonely winter.  Li darlin', it feels like years since you've been here.  Her comes the Sun...Here comes the sun...And I say, "It's alright..." And the CREDITS ROLL.
